thread.title: Flood waters damage hundreds of cars in northern New England
thread.title_full: Flood waters damage hundreds of cars in northern New England - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Flood waters damage hundreds of cars in northern New England
text:
PORTLAND, Maine (AP) - A massive rainstorm that produced flash floods is going to prove costly for northern New England.
AAA of Northern New England says it had to call in extra tow trucks as it responded Wednesday to more than 1,500 calls across the three-state region.
Spokesman Pat Moody estimates that about 250 cars and trucks were flooded in Portland, Maine, where the rainfall dislodged manhole covers and waist-high floodwaters caused cars to stall out. Parking lots full of cars were flooded, as well.
He recommends to have flooded cars checked out by a mechanic before trying to drive them.
More than 6 inches of rain fell across parts of Maine. New Hampshire saw more than 5 inches, as well. Vermont saw heavy rain, but not as much as that.
